title: NASA Scrubs Spacewalk
summary: A spacewalk at the International Space Station this morning was scrubbed because of a “spacesuit discomfort” issue. The two NASA astronauts, Tracy Dyson and Matt Dominick, were scheduled to conduct […]

title: LeoLabs wins AFWERX contract to develop next-generation radar
summary: LeoLabs announced plans June 13 to build a new type of radar under a $1.245 million AFWERX contract.

title: China’s secretive spaceplane conducts proximity operations with small spacecraft
summary: China’s experimental reusable spaceplane has been using a smaller spacecraft to test proximity operations, potentially even capturing the object.

title: Armenia signs Artemis Accords
summary: Armenia signed the Artemis Accords regarding safe and responsible space exploration June 12, the tenth country to do so this year.

title: Congressional letter asks NASA to rescind Chandra cuts
summary: Nine members of Congress have asked NASA to reconsider any significant changes to operations of the Chandra X-Ray Observatory linked to proposed cuts in the space telescope’s budget.

title: Thales, Spire and ESSP to develop air traffic surveillance constellation
summary: Thales, Spire Global and the European Satellite Services Provider announced a memorandum of cooperation June 13 to develop a satellite constellation dedicated to air traffic surveillance.

title: No Emergency Situation Aboard the International Space Station
summary: No Emergency Situation Aboard the International Space Station

title: Pentagon To Move Forward With SpaceX Starshield for Secure Satellite Communications
summary: Pentagon To Move Forward With SpaceX Starshield for Secure Satellite Communications

title: AI transforming satellite imaging industry ‘but it’s not magic’
summary: Planet's senior vice president Troy Toman says the company is resetting expectations around AI’s capabilities to solve complex problems

title: RocketLab Secures Nearly $50 Million in Funding for New Mexico Solar Cell Factory Expansion
summary: RocketLab Secures Nearly $50 Million in Funding for New Mexico Solar Cell Factory Expansion
